[Page Title: Mt Pleasant VFW – Post 10624 & Auxillary]

Skip to content Welcome to VFW Post 10624 & Auxillary About Us No one does more for Veterans 
We understand the unique bond you share with other veterans of overseas conflicts because we, too, have been there. No matter which conflict called you to service, we invite you to join us as we continue to fight for all that’s good FOR VETERANS.
Learn more Still Serving 
The Mount Pleasant, SC VFW Post 10624 is deeply committed to serving those who have bravely served their country. This dedication stems from a profound sense of camaraderie and a shared understanding of the sacrifices made by veterans. The post recognizes that the transition from military to civilian life can be challenging, and it strives to ease this process by offering support and advocacy for veterans and their families. By providing assistance in filing applications for benefits from the Department of Veterans Affairs, the post ensures that veterans receive the recognition and support they deserve. Moreover, the VFW post acts as a pillar of community, fostering an environment where veterans can find solidarity, access resources, and engage in activities that contribute to their well-being. Their tireless efforts are a testament to the belief that those who have served their nation deserve unwavering support and the opportunity to lead fulfilling lives post-service.

Community Outreach

We are the voice of veterans in the Lowcountry. We remember the sacrifices and honor their memory through service. Everyday is an outreach for us.

Leadership and Guidance

Our activities often involve local R.O.T.C. cadets and other youth volunteers. We provide opportunities for service and to earn distinction through actions.

Event Space

Let us be your host! From community oyster roasts to private events. The Mt. Pleasant VFW can be your event venue with full kitchen for up to 125 people.

Sign up for updates delivered to your inbox.

Rack ‘Em Up! VFW Pool Tournament Raises Over $1,600! November 2, 2025 
What a day! The Mt. Pleasant VFW Post recently hosted the Scotch APA 8-Ball Doubles Tournament that was a smashing success, bringing our community together for some friendly competition and raising a significant amount of money for our Post. We are thrilled to announce that the event successfully raised over $1,600 for the VFW! Thank […]

VFW Post 10624 in Mount Pleasant is proud to announce its participation in the National Day of Service by hosting a food drop-off event to support the V.A. Food bank on Sunday, May 4, 2025. Members of the community are warmly invited to contribute non-perishable food items at VFW Post 10624, located at 1411 Stuart […]

VFW Post 10624 invites you to honor our heroes at the 83rd Annual Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day. The ceremony will take place aboard the historic USS Yorktown in Charleston Harbor, beginning at 11 AM. Following the ceremony, join us for lunch at VFW Post 10624. Free parking is available in the old parking lot from […]
Read More about December 7th Pearl Harbor Remembrance ceremony Post 10624 visits the Vietnam Veterans Memorial Replica Traveling Wall November 4, 2024 
“The Wall that Heals and mobile education center” The Wall That Heals is a half-scale replica of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial in Washington, D.C. It travels across the United States, providing communities with the opportunity to honor and remember the veterans who served in the Vietnam War. The wall bears the names of the over […]

Originally founded in 1899 as the American Veterans of Foreign Service, the Veterans of Foreign Wars continues to be a voice for returning and currently deployed service members and their families. The Veterans of Foreign Wars is dedicated to supporting those who sacrifice so much for this country, veterans, service members in the US Armed […]

VFW Post 10624 commemorated Memorial Day with a heartfelt mission to honor fallen veterans. Despite a rainy start, a dedicated group of volunteers, including veterans, families, and JROTC Cadets, came together to ensure each veteran’s gravestone at Mt. Pleasant Memorial Gardens received an American flag as a symbol of recognition for their service to our […]

VFW Post 10624’s National Day of Service on May 4th, 2024 was a heartwarming display of community spirit, overcoming a rainy morning to collect a significant donation for local veterans. Over 800 pounds of non-perishable goods were collected through a drive-thru drop off event and donation boxes placed at participating businesses throughout Mount Pleasant. But […]

VFW Post 10624 Glen L. Jeffers welcomes you to join our National Day of Service with a drive-through food drop off. We will be accepting non-perishable foodstuffs and donating them to the VA Food Bank.
